subject: Religion & Spirituality
title: Ahimsa: Non-Violence as Religion
description: A fast breakdown of Ahimsa: Non-Violence as Religion for builders.

hook.text: Don't kill. Don't harm. Don't even think violent thoughts. Ahimsa is non-violence so radical it changes how you eat.

buildup.text: Ahimsa appears in Hinduism, Buddhism, and Jainism. It means avoiding harm to all living beings, in thought and deed.

discovery.text: For Jains, ahimsa is absolute: monks sweep the ground before walking to avoid stepping on insects. Total compassion.

twist.text: Gandhi turned ahimsa into a political weapon. Non-violent resistance toppled the British Empire without firing a shot.

climax.text: Ahimsa shows that passivity and non-violence differ. Choosing peace in a violent world is the hardest fight of all.

punchline.text: Non-violence toppled an empire. Ahimsa is peace as a weapon.
